title: Level 6 Space Practice Test
description: Test your skills with the Cartesian plane, coordinates, transformations, angles, and classifying triangles.

questions.question: In which quadrant is the point $(-3, 5)$?
questions.explanation: The $x$-coordinate is negative and the $y$-coordinate is positive. This combination places the point in Quadrant II (top-left).

questions.question: What are the coordinates of a point that is $4$ units right and $2$ units down from the origin?
questions.explanation: Right means positive $x$: $x = 4$. Down means negative $y$: $y = -2$. The point is $(4, -2)$.

questions.question: Two angles on a straight line are $72°$ and $x°$. What is $x$?
questions.explanation: Angles on a straight line sum to $180°$. So $x = 180 - 72 = 108°$.

questions.question: Which transformation flips a shape over a line to create a mirror image?
questions.explanation: A reflection flips a shape over a line of reflection (mirror line), creating a mirror image. A translation slides and a rotation turns.

questions.question: A triangle has angles of $60°$, $60°$, and $60°$. What type of triangle is it?
questions.explanation: All three angles are equal ($60°$ each), which means all three sides are also equal. This is an equilateral triangle.

questions.question: A point $A(2, 3)$ is translated $5$ units left and $1$ unit up. What are the new coordinates?
questions.explanation: $5$ units left: $x = 2 - 5 = -3$. $1$ unit up: $y = 3 + 1 = 4$. New coordinates: $(-3, 4)$.

questions.question: Three angles meet at a point. Two of them are $130°$ and $95°$. What is the third angle?
questions.explanation: Angles at a point sum to $360°$. Third angle $= 360 - 130 - 95 = 135°$.

questions.question: A triangle has angles of $35°$ and $90°$. What is the third angle?
questions.explanation: Angles in a triangle sum to $180°$. Third angle $= 180 - 35 - 90 = 55°$.

questions.question: The point $(0, -4)$ lies on which axis?
questions.explanation: When the $x$-coordinate is $0$, the point lies on the $y$-axis. $(0, -4)$ is $4$ units below the origin on the $y$-axis.

questions.question: A shape is rotated $90°$ clockwise, then another $90°$ clockwise. What single rotation is this equivalent to?
questions.explanation: Two $90°$ clockwise rotations add up to $90° + 90° = 180°$ clockwise (which is the same as $180°$ anticlockwise — a half turn).
